text: Spezia Calcio is an Italian professional football club which plays in La Spezia, Liguria. They currently play in Serie A. The 2020–21 season was their first season in the top division. Their home games are played at Stadio Alberto Picco. It has a capacity of 10,000. == Names == *1906-1911: S.C. Spezia *1911-1936: F.B.C. Spezia *1936-1954: A.C. Spezia *1954-1955: A.C. Spezia-Arsenal *1955-1986: F.B.C. Spezia 1906 *1986-1995: A.C. Spezia *1995-2008: Spezia Calcio *2008-2009: A.S.D. Spezia Calcio *2009-present: Spezia Calcio == Titles == *Campionato Alta Italia (Serie A) **Winners: 1944 *Serie C / Serie C1 **Winners (3): 1935–36, 2005–06, 2011–12 **Runners-up: 2001–02 *Serie C2 **Winners: 1999–2000 **Runners-up (3): 1979–80, 1985–86, 2009–10 *Serie D: **Winners (2): 1957–58, 1965–66 **Runners-up (2): 1955–56, 2008–09 == League positions == Season League Position 2000–01 Serie C1 Group A – 5th 2001–02 Serie C1 Group A – 2nd 2002–03 Serie C1 Group A – 6th 2003–04 Serie C1 Group A – 6th 2004–05 Serie C1 Group A – 7th 2005–06 Serie C1 Group A – Champion 2006–07 Serie B 19th 2007–08 Serie B 21st 2008–09 Serie D Group A – 2nd 2009–10 2da Divisione Group B – 2nd 2010–11 1ma Divisione Group A – 6th 2011–12 Lega Pro Prima Divisione Group B – Champion 2012–13 Serie B 13th 2013–14 Serie B 8th 2014–15 Serie B 5th 2015–16 Serie B 7th 2016–17 Serie B 8th 2017–18 Serie B 10th 2018–19 Serie B 6th 2019-20 Serie B 3rd === Former league positions === Category:1906 establishments in Italy Category:Italian football clubs Category:La Spezia
